alert.note: Alert for Carter; Custer; Fallon; Powder River (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 22 at 11:38AM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: .A strong storm system will produce areas of heavy rain for southern Montana and northern Wyoming. The heavy rain will combine with already saturated soils and may lead to flooding. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH LATE SATURDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Montana, including the following counties, Carter, Custer, Fallon and Powder River. * WHEN...From late tonight through late Saturday night. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Extensive street flooding and flooding of creeks and rivers are possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Widespread rainfall totals of 1-3 inches are expected. Areas that experience training thunderstorms may see 3-5 inches of rainfall in just a couple hours. This rainfall combined with already saturated soils may lead to flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
